p: Climate in the region is semiarid and temperate, with average annual precipitation of 574.4 mm (precipitation is seasonally distributed, with 60% falling in autumn-winter) and an average annual temperature of 8.6Â°C (non-published data from the meteorological station on San Ramon ranch). Strong W-NW winds are frequent all year round, with a mean speed of 30 km/h [ 46]. The dominant soil types are moderately developed (Haploxerolls) with a loamy-sandy texture and superficial horizons containing moderate organic matter [ 47]. The typical vegetation consists mainly of a matrix dominated by the grasses Pappostipa speciosa and Festuca pallescens, and by scattered shrubs such as Azorella prolifera and Senecio bracteolatus. Shrubs and grasses are intermixed with small native and exotic herbs [ 43].
